ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I prefer complex to simple problems.
Notes: 1= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 2= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 4= Somewhat characteristic of me; 5= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: I like to have the responsibility of handling a situation that requires a lot of thinking.
Notes: 1= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 2= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 4= Somewhat characteristic of me; 5= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: Thinking is not my idea of fun. (reverse)
Notes: 5= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 4= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 2= Somewhat characteristic of me; 1= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: I would rather do something that requires little thought than something that is sure to challenger my thinking abilities. (reverse)
Notes: 5= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 4= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 2= Somewhat characteristic of me; 1= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: I try to anticipate and avoid situations where there is a likely chance I will have to think in depth about something. (reverse)
Notes: 5= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 4= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 2= Somewhat characteristic of me; 1= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: I find satisfaction in deliberating hard and for long hours.
Notes: 1= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 2= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 4= Somewhat characteristic of me; 5= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: I only think as hard as I have to. (reverse)
Notes: 5= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 4= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 2= Somewhat characteristic of me; 1= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: I prefer to think about small daily projkects to long term ones. (reverse)
Notes: 5= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 4= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 2= Somewhat characteristic of me; 1= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: I like tasks that require little thought once I've learned them. (reverse)
Notes: 5= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 4= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 2= Somewhat characteristic of me; 1= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: The idea of relying on thought to make my way to the top appeals to me.
Notes: 1= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 2= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 4= Somewhat characteristic of me; 5= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: I really enjoy a task that involves coming up with new solutions to problems.
Notes: 1= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 2= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 4= Somewhat characteristic of me; 5= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: Learning new ways to think doesn't excite me very much. (reverse)
Notes: 5= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 4= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 2= Somewhat characteristic of me; 1= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: I prefer my life to be filled with puzzles I must solve.
Notes: 1= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 2= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 4= Somewhat characteristic of me; 5= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: The notion of thinking abstractly is appealing to me.
Notes: 1= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 2= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 4= Somewhat characteristic of me; 5= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: I would prefer a task that is intellectual, difficult, and important to one that is somewhat important but does not require much thought.
Notes: 1= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 2= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 4= Somewhat characteristic of me; 5= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: I feel relief rather than satisfaction after completing a task that requires a lot of mental effort. (reverse)
Notes: 5= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 4= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 2= Somewhat characteristic of me; 1= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: It's enough for me that something gets the job done; I don't care how or why it works. (reverse)
Notes: 5= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 4= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 2= Somewhat characteristic of me; 1= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: I usually end up deliberating about issues even when they do not affect me personally.
Notes: 1= Extremely uncharacteristic of me; 2= Somewhat uncharacteristic of me; 3= Uncertain; 4= Somewhat characteristic of me; 5= Extremely characteristic of me; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: Need for Cognition Scale Total
I prefer to think about small daily projects to long term ones. (Reverse Scored)
Notes: 4= Very strong disagreement; 3= Strong disagreement; 2= Moderate disagreement; 1= Slightly disagreement; 0= Neither agreement nor disagreement; -1= Slight agreement; -2= Moderate agreement; -3= Strong agreement; -4= Very strong agreement

Notes: 4= Very strong disagreement; 3= Strong disagreement; 2= Moderate disagreement; 1= Slightly disagreement; 0= Neither agreement nor disagreement; -1= Slight agreement; -2= Moderate agreement; -3= Strong agreement; -4= Very strong agreement

ElementDescription: Need for Cognition Scale Total (9-point scale)
